newsitem.title: USA: Ohio Governor signs $36 bln biennium budget.
newsitem.headline: Ohio Governor signs $36 bln biennium budget.

text.p: Ohio Gov. George Voinovich signed a $36.07 billion general fund budget Monday for fiscal 1997-99.
Ohio lawmakers had forwarded the budget for the fiscal biennium beginning Tuesday to Voinovich last week.
The budget includes a new indexing of personal income tax exemptions and a 4.5 percent income tax cut totalling $286 million for taxes payable in 1998.
Lawmakers included $250 million for school construction assistance in the budget added to previously approved authority to issue $300 million of school construction bonds as needed.
Ohio also has another $100 million of school construction bond authority remaining from the capital spending plan approved last year.
Cash-strapped Central State University near Dayton received $28 million in aid and $6 million of capital spending authority in the higher education budget.
Head Start childcare programs will receive $83.7 million in fiscal 1998 and $97.5 million in fiscal 1999. Childcare subsidies will total $229 million in fiscal 1998 and $252 in fiscal 1999.
Voinovich also exercised his line-item veto to strike 17 provisions.
